asset.notes: Following enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Unknown.

confidentiality.notes: The nearly 800,000 records include email addresses, usernames, and dates for when the account was created and last logged into.

discovery_notes: Troy Hunt, a security researcher and creator of the breach notification site Have I Been Pwned?, first flagged the data breach to Motherboard earlier this month. Motherboard obtained a sample of the data and provided a copy to Warframe, which verified its authenticity.  "After a thorough review of the data we received, we can confirm that a list of 775,749 email addresses were acquired through a Drupal SQL exploit that was patched by Drupal two weeks after the breach occurred.
notes: User details for online, free-to-play game 'Warframe' are being traded in the digital underground. The nearly 800,000 records include email addresses, usernames, and dates for when the account was created and last logged into.

development.notes: VERIS 1.3.6: value_chain.development.variety.Email added because action.social.vector.Email exists.

targeting.notes: VERIS 1.3.6: value_chain.targeting.variety.Email addresses added because action.social.vector.Email exists.
